results.name: Twinrova
results.description:
From Ocarina of Time's Spirit Temple, Twinrova is the final phase of the temple boss fight against Koume and Kotake.

Why did I choose her? Well, she came about because often when I draw, I think about and listen to comedy.  One day I happened to think "if someone were to sleep with Twinrova, would it be considered a three way?" Because I think about the important things in life.  

Thus, the idea was born. That and I realized I've never done a female character before, besides Joan from Clone High and thought I should represent my gender at least once.
results.merch_link: Not available for purchase at this time.

results.name: Does Deadhand Give Good Hugs?
results.description:
Remember the creepy hand guy that ruined everyone's childhood?
Well, I decided it would be a great idea to draw a picture of him.

His name is deadhead, he's from the Spirit Temple in Ocarina of Time and is the literal reason I didn't beat the game until I was a fully grown adult.

Kid me saw this guy and was like "noooooope. I'm out."

Fast-forward to adult me. I finally worked up the courage to face my fears.  I entered the mini battle, destroyed the evil hands, and was left wondering.... with all those hands, do you think Deadhand would give good hugs?

Still don't have an answer.. but I like to think he does.

results.name: Witch Doctor Chansey
results.description:
I think creepy things are funny.
This one is the result of my brain going "you know what would be hilarious....? If Chansey was an evil witch doctor outside of the Pokemon Centre."
results.merch_link: Not available for purchase at this time.

results.name: Firelord Azula
results.description: Not much backstory behind this one; I just like villains, lightening and dragons.  Azula is one of my favourite villains of all time.

results.name: Puppet Zant
results.description:
Hands down my favorite retro Zelda game. I've had many people fight me on this, but I stand by it.

Zant was a cool character, but was just a mere puppet of my favorite villain-- Ganon.

This one comes from me wanting to practice more... human-like.. character design.

results.name: Take it to the Fridge
results.description:
I was obsessed with the DK rap as a kid.  Also, dope game.
My favorite part of the rap was when Cranky Kong took it to the fridge.
I've never known why this is hilarious to me, but it is and so I made a Cranky Kong inspired DK music group as tribute. The background is bananas, literally.

results.name: Pokemon Master Dragonite
results.description:
It is said that Dragonite's intelligence rivals the intelligence of humans-- so I thought, why couldn't it tame it's own pokemon?
Why not make them Gyarados?
Why not make those Gyarados shiny?

Basically, my goal for this one was just to make an epic depiction of Dragonite. I think it was a success.

results.name: I like rusty spoons...
results.description: Salad Fingers came about when I was working on my creepy pokemon series because he kind of just fit right in.  He also happened because I was participating in Draw Movember challenge.. I believe the theme that day was "creepy;" Nailed it.

results.name: Thanks for the trippy adventure
results.description:
Clone High is my favorite show.
Gandhi's raisin trip is one of my favorite side adventures in the whole 13 episode series; everything about it is perfect.

results.name: Do You Want to Play With me...?
results.description:
Fierce Deity Link is my favorite version of Link.  I really wish there was more gameplay with him.  

This drawing took extensive planning and so many drafts.   Each character has at least 3 drafts and once I was happy with each individual, I started combining them together. So I have a whole bunch of partial drawings of this just kicking around my house.

results.name: Suave Animal
results.description:
From Draw Movember, I gave the world Suave Animal. It seemed appropriate, and Animal was the only muppet I really liked.  

This drawing is pretty  much the only one I've ever done of a subject I don't really care about.  I'm not a huge muppets fan; puppets creep me out.

results.name: Larry and Mauriece
results.description:
I just really needed to own some Freaky Stories art... turns out it's hard to come by soooo I just made my own.

This was my faaaavorite show growing up.

results.name: You Made Charizard Angry
results.description:
Charizard is my favorite pokemon so this drawing is from my heart, guys.  There are two versions, this is the blue fire one.  Why blue fire? Good question! It is blue fire because when Charizard gets angry its fire turns blue.  
I chose mega and shiny because, why not?

results.name: Master of Disguise
results.description:
My favourite disguise enthusiast: James from Team Rocket.
He is another product from Draw Movember, but I think he rocks that moustache real nice.  He was also one of my favorite characters ever.  If he was a person in real life we would probably be friends.

results.name: Milky Joe and the Coconuts
results.description:
How great was The Mighty Boosh, though? I've spent many of hours watching the ridiculous mind child of Noel Feilding and Julian Barratt.
My love for Matt Berry's amazing hair started here. 
The Nightmare of Milky Joe is probably my favorite episode.. it's hard to choose, but one day I decided it would be funny to use them for a Draw Movember prompt. No regrets.
results.merch_link: Not available for purchase at this time.

results.name: Ori and the Blind Forest ** UPDATE IMG
results.description: Sometimes I stray from pencils, I know, le gasp!  This was a result of me practicing ink drawing.

results.name: Wolf Goddess Moro
results.description: Princess Mononoke inspired, Wolf Goddess Moro. She actually became a tattoo on my forearm.

results.name: Betty the Sushi Shark ** UPDATE IMG
results.description:
Robin, hand me down the shark repellent bat-spray!
I really love the ocean and Betty the sushi shark became part of my future ocean sleeve. Originally designed by my sister, I sketched out a few more size options.
When finished my ocean sleeve will have epic creatures, and are placed on my arm based on how deep they reside in the ocean.  Someone better figure out what's at the bottom of the ocean before I get down to my shoulder, haha.

results.name: STAMOS
results.description:
Poor Scudzy.
He just wanted to be prom king.
I actually draw this up all the time and give it to random people.  I made a template that I can easily replicate in about 15 mins, colouring included. Scudz is my favorite Clone High character... not just because he has a desk drawer full of paper pirate hats, because he's the kind of guy, that when life gives him lemons, he clones those lemons and makes super lemons!!!!!!

results.name: Ghirahim Needs a Moustache
results.description:
This is the most appropriate moustache I could have ever chosen for my favourite evil diva. 
This was a sketch from Draw Movember and it kills me, every time because that facial expression and that moustache pair so well together. Sometimes I make some pretty great gems on accident.

results.name: Greymon
results.description:
I miss Digimon.
This turned into a weird Digital World - Greymon pencil crayon drawing.  
I wasn't happy with the result of that drawing, but I made a separate template sketch for it, this sketch, just in case I in fact, didn't like the end product.

results.name: Charizard
results.description: I just really love Charizard so I draw it often. I'm on a quest to make the perfect Charizard drawing (for me) but I don't know what I want apparently, because I have not created it nor do I have any idea why the existing ones aren't epic enough.

results.name: Ghirahim's Fantasy
results.description:
Not a huge fan of Skyward Sword but am a huge fan of this violence-hungry diva.  I just imagine this moment would make him so happy; he must fantasize about it often. 
He's up for sale, but I'm pretty sure I'm the only one who wants him.

results.name: A Night at the Opera Starring Jigglypuff
results.description:
First off-- This drawing glows in the dark. How cool, right? I did it on purpose. Jpuff had the honour of becoming my first glow in the dark pencil drawing experiment.  Eventually, I'll have the glow in the dark versions of art up here, just not today. 

Anyway, my brain spawned this idea mainly from the actual Pokemon tv show. So remember in Pokemon when J-puff would get suuuuuper offended every time all them pokeFolk fell asleep on her and so she would draw on everybody's faces?
Well.
I was like "that's pretty funny, but it would be more funny if the mic also had a hidden switchblade."  
The show clearly hinted that Jigglypuff has some anger issues, just sayin'... maybe she snapped.
results.merch_link: Not for sale... for eternity. This one is just for me.

results.name: ADD is not Infectious
results.description:
ADD has warped his mind!
Clone High was such a great show.
Every day I'm sad there are only 13 episodes. Every day, I hope ever so slightly, that it'll make a comeback.

I made this drawing because a fellow Clone High fan requested it.  It's from Episode 3: ADD: The Last D is for Disorder.

Hilarious episode, as they all are. I tried to jam all my favorite moments from the episode into one drawing. I think it turned out OK.  I may remake it in the future, but digitally-- I think a graphic drawing would suit it a bit better.

results.name: Ninetails from Nineteen
results.description:
I drew this up when I was 19.  It was supposed to be for my sister, but I'm not great at parting with my drawings... partially because they take a lot of time, effort and love on my part, and also I'm forgetful.

Let's see... I made this 7 years ago, wow, time files. So I guess this foxy gal has been around for a while, but I think she's held up throughout the years.  I still love this drawing a lot, and, well, you can't see it, but I know it's ripped. Perfect opportunity to create an updated version, n'est pas?

results.name: Ninetails Fire and Ice
results.description:
Found out there was a new Ice type for Vulpix and Ninetails, thought it was a good opportunity to actually make my sister a Ninetails drawing, like I promised her, 7 years ago.

The funny part is that this drawing isn't done. It's just hanging out like this until I decide how and what kind of background I want to do for it.

I think it would benefit from a more nature themed background, but we'll see. Hopefully I get a Ninetails drawing to my sister before it hits 10 years, haha.

results.name: Shiny Charizard
results.description:
I actually hate the way this turned out. Too much black and too much detail on the mountains and the whole background in general. All of it is distracting from my main dragon-- Charizard. Sorry, Lizard... for anyone about to get on my case about that.

I know he's a fire/flying, OK?

But it looks like a dragon, and I like dragons. So sometimes I call him a dragon, and the world can just deal with that.

results.name: Both Versions of the Charizard Battle
results.description:
Blue Fire is my favorite.
I've fought a few people on that.
I get in a lot of disagreements over Pokemon, but I can't stand idly by and have people be wrong about Pokemon and art at the same time, you know?

All jokes aside, I had a lot of fun making these. I made them at the same time. It was the first time I've drawn fire and the thing about fire, is that it can really be any shape you want, it comes down to how you shade and blend the colours together.  Although, the blue version definitely requires the context or else it would probably be mistaken for water. 

But I made them for me, and I love them, so who cares what anyone else thinks? ... I make this statement frequently.

I had a heartfelt request to make the blue one obtainable, so it can be purchased on various things on Redbubble.

results.name: I have not named this one yet
results.description:
Drawing armies = very repetitive.
That was the main lesson I learned drawing this one.

Worth it though, because now I have a sweet Sokka drawing, Water Tribe war paint and all.

I used navy for a lot of the shading and instead of #000 black style, I used a more charcoal grey.  Something I've been trying out, is seeing if I can carry out my dark style of art, using a lot less pure black.  Why? Great question. I did this because blending black into colours takes away the vividness of them. It drives me crazy, and so I have been gravitating toward only using it for outlines and completely blacked out areas.

I like the results.
results.merch_link: Currently not for sale, but will be.

results.name: I Fixed Venusaur
results.description:
Whenever someone told me they chose Bulbasaur over Charmander and/or Squirtle I never understood.  Cause like.. who the heck cares about Venusaur? Worst original starter. Let's be real.

So, I thought about it, and came up with this. See, if this was Venusaur, I could tooootally understand going green. But in reality, it's like a derpy giant toad thing. 

The worst part about this drawing, specifically for me, is that I created a Venusaur drawing that I like more then alllll my Charizard attempts.

What a kick in the face, eh? Fucking Venusaur.

results.name: I Killed Mufasa
results.description:
The older I get, the more I relate to Scar. Perhaps the scariest sentence I've said so far.

But in all fairness-- in order to take over a pride the other lion does have to beat the Alpha.

And in more fairness, Scar's pitch to rule is that everyone could have food. He was just trying to end racism against hyenas. 

I hope I just shattered your childhood on some level. Or made you really angry. Or made a new friend. All three options make me happy.

If you made it this far, you get to know that this drawing glows in the dark.  It's part of a glow in the dark drawing series I'm currently (April 2017 currently) developing.
results.merch_link: Not done, so not for sale.

results.name: Bone Dragon
results.description:
Hands down one of my favorite games of all time.  Sometimes I can just hear the yoshi's singing in my head.

This drawing is going to go under heavy construction... I'm just not happy with how dark (literally) I made the background. I think I can make a much better version of the Bone Dragon.

I drew this a few years ago. So it's due for an upgrade anyway.
results.merch_link: Not good enough to be for sale

results.name: Rainbow Ninetails
results.description:
I was experimenting with water colour.
I happened to have a bunch of Ninetails templates drawn out from another drawing I was making of this foxy Pokemon.

I went rainbow, because pride. :)

Also, I may be too messy a human to be a successful water colour painter.
But. I did have a lot of fun learning it for a couple of evenings.

I think with some design tweaks she'd make a lovely tattoo.

results.name: Arcanine Water Colour
results.description:
Second water colour attempt. This one turned out muuuch better since I had a little bit of water colour experimentation under my belt at this point.

I really dig the cool colour choice as opposed to the actual orange & warmer colours Arcanine rocks.

I think he would make a pretty nice water colour style tattoo. With maybe some tweaks by someone who knows about that style more the I do, haha.
